title: Swarm Intelligence: Nature-Inspired Solutions
description: Discover how collective behavior in nature—like ants finding food or birds flocking—can inspire powerful problem-solving algorithms in AI, robotics, and beyond.
author: Akshat G & Manas Waykole

title: A simple introduction to Genetic Algorithms
description: This article breaks down the basics of genetic algorithms, how they work and explores their exciting applications in fields like finance, and healthcare.
author: Arnav Upadhyay

title: Fuzzy systems for beginners
description: Ready to dive into the world of AI and explore how fuzzy logic makes sense of the uncertain? This is your ultimate guide to understanding fuzzy systems in a simple, fun, and practical way!
author: Ethan Van Buerle & Krittika Ray

title: Neural Turing Machines: Bridging Neural Networks and Memory for Advanced AI
description: Enter the 𝗡𝗲𝘂𝗿𝗮𝗹 𝗧𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗠𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗲 (𝗡𝗧𝗠) - an incredible fusion of neural networks and memory, inspired by the mechanics of the human brain!
author: Atharva Lotlikar & Sreenand Sai T A

title: Self Organizing Maps: An introduction
description: In this piece, we dive deep into SOMs—a neural network technique created by Teuvo Kohonen in the 1980s that transforms high-dimensional data into a lower-dimensional, easy-to-understand format.
author: Aarushie Joshi & Manas Waykole

title: Chaos Theory, Neural Networks, and Mathematics: The Backbone of Modern AI
description: mathematical principles that fuel cutting-edge AI models like ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, and Copilot.
author: Ethan Van Buerle & Shartak Verma

title: The fundamentals of Reinforcement learning
description: This article explains everything one needs to know to get started in the field of Reinforcement learning. From the fundamentals to the algorithms, applications and challenges, this article covers it all.
author: Aditya R Jemshetty, Jaisika Pradhan & Rushil Bakori
